title: Rerunning the session does not work inside callbacks
body: ### Summary `st.experimental_rerun()` and `Session.request_rerun()` do not work correctly inside callbacks. This is similar to https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/3533 ### Steps to reproduce This report is based on `streamlit==0.89.0`. #### Ver. 1 Code snippet: ```py import streamlit as st text_value1 = st.text_input("input1") st.write(f"text_value1={text_value1}") def on_change(): st.experimental_rerun() text_value2 = st.text_input("input2", on_change=on_change) st.write(f"text_value2={text_value2}") text_value3 = st.text_input("input3") st.write(f"text_value3={text_value3}") ``` 1. Input texts to the `input1` and `input3`, for example, "aaa" and "ccc" respectively. Make sure the each input value is displayed throught `st.write()`. 2. Input a text to the `input2`, for example "bbb" and hit the enter key, which triggers `st.experimental_rerun()` in the callback function. 3. Then, **all the component values of `st.text_input()`-s are reset so that `st.write()`-s show empty values**. 4. After that, all the text inputs do not work - you can input texts but nothing happens after hitting the enter key. #### Ver. 2 Replacing `st.experimental_rerun()` to `ReportSession.request_rerun(None)` improves the situation a bit, though it still does not work well. Code snippet: ```py import streamlit as st import streamlit.report_thread as ReportThread from streamlit.server.server import Server def get_this_session(): ctx = ReportThread.get_report_ctx() current_server = Server.get_current() session_id = ctx.session_id session_info = current_server._get_session_info(session_id) if session_info is None: raise Exception("Session not found.") return session_info.session text_value1 = st.text_input("input1") st.write(f"text_value1={text_value1}") def on_change(): this_session = get_this_session() this_session.request_rerun(None) text_value2 = st.text_input("input2", on_change=on_change) st.write(f"text_value2={text_value2}") text_value3 = st.text_input("input3") st.write(f"text_value3={text_value3}") ``` 1. Follow the 1st and 2nd steps as the previous example, which triggers `ReportSession.request_rerun(None)` in this case instead. 2. Then, **the 2nd and 3rd text inputs and their component values are broken like above while the 1st text input is working well in this case**. **Expected behavior:** All the component work well after rerunning the session. **Actual behavior:** Explained above. ### Is this a regression? No, but the results differ with different Streamlit versions. While in this issue, v0.89.0 is used, you can see different (but still buggy) behavior with other versions. ### Debug info - Streamlit version: Streamlit, version 0.89.0 - Python version: Python 3.8.7 - Using Conda? PipEnv? PyEnv? Pex?: `pyenv` + `python -m venv - OS version: macOS BigSur 11.5.2 - Browser version: Brave 1.29.79 Chromium: 93.0.4577.63（Official Build） （arm64） ### Additional information If needed, add any other context about the problem here. For example, did this bug come from https://discuss.streamlit.io or another site? Link the original source here!
